GridOptions (class in module ui.grid )

Description

Default GridOptions class. GridOptions are defined by the application developer and overlaid over this object.

Usage

GridOptions();

Methods

  • rowEquality(entityA, entityB)

    By default, rows are compared using object equality. This option can be overridden to compare on any data item property or function

    Parameters

    • entityA – {object} –

      First Data Item to compare

    • entityB – {object} –

      Second Data Item to compare

Properties

  • columnDefs

    (optional) Array of columnDef objects. Only required property is name. field property can be used in place of name for backwards compatibilty with 2.x

    Example

    var columnDefs = [{name:'field1'}, {name:'field2'}];

  • data

    Array of data to be rendered to grid. Array can contain complex objects

  • enableRowHashing

    (optional) True by default. When enabled, this setting allows uiGrid to add $$hashKey-type properties (similar to Angular) to elements in the data array. This allows the grid to maintain state while vastly speeding up the process of altering data by adding/moving/removing rows.

    Note that this DOES add properties to your data that you may not want, but they are stripped out when using angular.toJson(). IF you do not want this at all you can disable this setting but you will take a performance hit if you are using large numbers of rows and are altering the data set often.

  • excludeProperties

    (optional) Array of property names in data to ignore when auto-generating column names. defaults to ['$$hashKey'] If columnDefs is defined, this will be ignored.

  • getRowIdentity

    (optional) This function returns the identity value uniquely identifying this row.

    By default it returns the $$hashKey property but can be overridden to use any property or set of properties you want.

  • rowIdentity

    (optional) This function is used to get and, if necessary, set the value uniquely identifying this row.

    By default it returns the $$hashKey property if it exists. If it doesn't it uses gridUtil.nextUid() to generate one

Example

To provide default options for all of the grids within your application, use an angular decorator to modify the GridOptions factory. 

app.config(function($provide){
   $provide.decorator('GridOptions',function($delegate){
     return function(){
       var defaultOptions = new $delegate();
       defaultOptions.excludeProperties = ['id' ,'$$hashKey'];
       return defaultOptions;
     };
   })
 })
